eventData.title: The Nutcracker
eventData.description: Step into a world of wonder this holiday season with The Nutcracker, presented by Pioneer Valley Ballet! This beloved holiday tradition, filled with enchanting characters, stunning choreography, and Tchaikovsky’s iconic score, is the perfect way to celebrate the season with family and friends.

eventData.title: The Messiah

artists.name: The WREBC Symphony Orchestra and Chorus

eventData.description: The WREBC Symphony Orchestra and Chorus present “The Messiah” — a grand concert featuring the timeless works of renowned classical Eastern European composers and other celebrated masters. This inspiring program explores the birth and reign of Jesus Christ through some of the most moving and majestic compositions ever written. Join us for an evening where symphonic power and choral beauty come together to honor the Messiah’s coming, kingship, and glory.
eventData.descriptionHtml: The WREBC Symphony Orchestra and Chorus present “The Messiah” — a grand concert featuring the timeless works of renowned classical Eastern European composers and other celebrated masters. This inspiring program explores the birth and reign of Jesus Christ through some of the most moving and majestic compositions ever written. Join us for an evening where symphonic power and choral beauty come together to honor the Messiah’s coming, kingship, and glory.

eventData.title: Bach At New Year’s: The Six 'Brandenburg' Concertos

artists.name: The Berkshire Bach Society and NEPM

eventData.description: This event is participating in the Card to Culture Program! They will be offering 10 seats in the balcony at a discounted walkup price of $10 to any patrons with a valid EBT, WIC, or ConnectorCare card. To purchase these tickets, please visit or call the box office Tuesday through Friday between 3:00pm and 6:00pm. Limit 4 tickets per cardholder per show. Tickets are sold on a first-come-first-serve basis. Find out more at: https://massculturalcouncil.org/organizations/card-to-culture/

eventData.description: We are proud to participate in Mass Cultural Council’s Card to Culture program in collaboration with the Department of Transitional Assistance, the Department of Public Health’s WIC Nutrition Program, the Massachusetts Health Connector, and hundreds of cultural organizations across Massachusetts by expanding cultural access for low-income and working families.

eventData.title: The Monkee Men - Greatest Monkees Tribute
eventData.description: In 1967, The Monkees outsold The Beatles and The Rolling Stones combined. Their TV show won two Emmy Awards and the band produced five multi-platinum albums and six Billboard Top 10 singles including three #1’s. Today, their music continues to enchant audiences worldwide. With the passing of three of the original Monkees, the only way to experience that great music live on stage has been through Micky Dolenz’ ongoing solo tours.
eventData.descriptionHtml: In 1967, The Monkees outsold The Beatles and The Rolling Stones combined. Their TV show won two Emmy Awards and the band produced five multi-platinum albums and six Billboard Top 10 singles including three #1’s. Today, their music continues to enchant audiences worldwide. With the passing of three of the original Monkees, the only way to experience that great music live on stage has been through Micky Dolenz’ ongoing solo tours.

eventData.title: Come See Me in the Good Light: A Celebration of Andrea Gibson
eventData.description: Come See Me in the Good Light is a community held celebration of Andrea Gibson—their poems, their courage, and the way their words have carried so many of us through the darkest and brightest seasons of our lives. This documentary gathers us in shared breath and witness, honoring Andrea’s legacy of queer tenderness, political truth-telling, and radical love. It’s more than a screening; it’s a collective offering, a moment to stand together in the good light they taught us to seek, make, and protect.
eventData.descriptionHtml: Come See Me in the Good Light is a community held celebration of Andrea Gibson—their poems, their courage, and the way their words have carried so many of us through the darkest and brightest seasons of our lives. It’s more than a screening; it’s a collective offering, a moment to stand together in the good light they taught us to seek, make, and protect.

eventData.title: Dar Williams
eventData.description: “Dar Williams’ lyrics contain bouquets of optimism, delivered on melodies alternating between beguiling lightness and understated gravity. Williams strongly believes that all of us possess our own power and ability to achieve, and she rejects the exceptionalism that encourages us to “admire that yonder star,” while making us feel small and insignificant; unworthy of shining on our own but hoping to catch enough distant light to inspire some tiny accomplishment. Williams has always been very interested in how to control our future and this album has to do with the fact that at some point, you just can’t.
eventData.descriptionHtml: “Dar Williams’ lyrics contain bouquets of optimism, delivered on melodies alternating between beguiling lightness and understated gravity. Williams strongly believes that all of us possess our own power and ability to achieve, and she rejects the exceptionalism that encourages us to “admire that yonder star,” while making us feel small and insignificant; unworthy of shining on our own but hoping to catch enough distant light to inspire some tiny accomplishment. Williams has always been very interested in how to control our future and this album has to do with the fact that at some point, you just can’t.

eventData.title: Craig Ferguson: Pants on Fire
eventData.description: The Craig Ferguson show scheduled for December 4th at The Academy of Music has been postponed. The new date is Sunday, February 22nd, 2026. All tickets will be honored for the new date. If you are unable to make the new date, refunds are available until Wednesday, November 26th by contacting the Academy of Music Box Office.

eventData.title: Academy Regional Youth Poetry Slam
eventData.description: The Academy of Music Theatre presents the Fourth Annual Academy Regional Youth Poetry Slam on the Academy’s historic stage, where young poets from high schools across the Pioneer Valley perform original work for cash prizes.
eventData.descriptionHtml: The Academy of Music Theatre presents the Fourth Annual Academy Regional Youth Poetry Slam on the Academy’s historic stage, where young poets from high schools across the Pioneer Valley perform original work for cash prizes.

eventData.title: Best of Valley Voices Story Slam
eventData.description: The Academy of Music Theatre and New England Public Media celebrate their eleventh season of Best of Valley Story Slam! Audience members have selected the top three stories for the four Valley Voices Story Slams held in the last year. These tops stories by local storytellers will be shared on the Academy stage to compete for the top prize – Best of Valley Voices! Join us as we choose the winner of this competition based on the art of first-person narrative storytelling.
eventData.descriptionHtml: The Academy of Music Theatre and New England Public Media celebrate their eleventh season of Best of Valley Story Slam! Audience members have selected the top three stories for the four Valley Voices Story Slams held in the last year. These tops stories by local storytellers will be shared on the Academy stage to compete for the top prize – Best of Valley Voices! Join us as we choose the winner of this competition based on the art of first-person narrative storytelling.
